episodes.title: The Secretive Cult That Spread Through Small-Town Australia
episodes.description:
In 1982, Ken Dyers and Jan Hamilton founded a group called Kenja Communication. On the surface, it looked like a self-help program built on “energy release” and “personal communication.” But behind the closed doors of community halls in places like Wagga Wagga and Albury, many say it was something far darker.

Was Kenja simply an eccentric training program misunderstood by the media, or was it truly a destructive cult hiding in plain sight? Families say they watched loved ones change forever. Supporters insist it was unfairly targeted.

Join me as we uncover one of Australia’s strangest small-town stories — a tale of secrecy, control, and the vulnerability of communities searching for meaning.
